thread.title: Jets' Darrelle Revis involved in fight, may face charges, reports say
thread.title_full: Jets' Darrelle Revis involved in fight, may face charges, reports say

author: Brandon Schlager (bschlager@sportingnews.com)
title: Jets' Darrelle Revis involved in fight, may face charges, reports say
text:
February 16, 2017 6:05pm EST February 16, 2017 6:05pm EST American Football, News, English, Darrelle Revis, NFL, New York Jets The Jets cornerback reportedly was involved in an altercation early Monday and is under police investigation. Darrelle Revis (Getty Images) 
Updated at 6:05 p.m. ET 
Updated at 6:05 p.m. ET 
Jets cornerback Darrelle Revis is under police investigation over his role in an altercation in Pittsburgh earlier this week, but there are conflicting reports about who was the aggressor. 
Pittsburgh police are looking into an incident reported Monday around 2:30 a.m. involving Revis and two other men, according to WTAE-TV . The report, citing unnamed police sources, said Revis was spotted with the men by an on-duty patrol officer driving in a cruiser. When the officer returned, the two men were unconscious and Revis was no longer at the scene, according to WTAE, which added that police are considering filing felony charges against the NFL veteran. 
MORE: 40 most hated NFL players of all time: loudmouths, cheaters, criminals 
Revis' lawyer gave KDKA-TV a different account of the incident. He said Revis was "assaulted by a group of five people" and fled the scene because he "feared for his safety and eventually went to get medical treatment," according to KDKA. 
In a statement Thursday, the Jets acknowledged Revis' involvement in the incident but declined further comment. Watch This
